instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent No Power.
threads.message:
No liquid.
This board has G3H PP3V42, S5 Rails, but wont always go into S3. I find that when Im missing S3 that <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is missing as well. If I heat area around 7201 with hot air, I get all power rails back and machine boots. I have replaced <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> thinking that it was shorting <SIGNAL>PM_SLP</SIGNAL> to ground but no change.

Pin 4 <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> in diode. .490
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> .320

Short somewhere in 3v3 line?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent No Power.
threads.message: Could be anything. Is this a refurb board with no serial number on the RAM slot?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent No Power.
threads.message:
Its original... Since the hot air seems to fix it for like a day, shouldnt it be something around there? I didn't want to just start switching components blind to fix it. I would rather track it down and know exactly what it is. 
[url]https://photos.app.goo.gl/iGF5vurGniLQUgJT6[/url]

Thanks Duke. Take care.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent No Power.
threads.message: That is a refurb board! Insert into nearest trash receptacle.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Intermittent No Power.
threads.message: Haha, OK... NP. The Green Dot.? It was the Green Dot wasn't it? I vaugly remember this in another post. Lol. Take care man.
